about.kohei-yamamoto:
Kohei has achieved remarkable success by representing Japan in four consecutive Olympics since the Beijing Olympics. With 12 victories in the Japan Championships and 10 in the Asian Championships, he secured the 11th position in the world rankings in 2013.

A living legend in the Asian mountain biking scene, he currently engages in racing as a playing manager. Leveraging his past experiences, he actively works to pass on the beauty of sports to the younger generation. He strongly desires to contribute to Asia's journey towards achieving world championships.
about.yusuke-fukumitsu:
Born and raised in Hokkaido, Yusuke dedicated his school days to baseball, judo, and breakdancing. 

At 23, he opened an osteopathic clinic specializing as a judo therapist. Later, he acquired licenses as an acupuncturist and moxibustion practitioner (traditional Chinese medicine ), gaining steady demand from clients across Japan. Also, he serves as a multi-trainer, offering care and conditioning for professional athletes.

Currently, he efficiently manages six corporations with a staff of 300 people, overseeing nursing care and welfare businesses throughout Japan. His motto, 'Passion is talent,' guides his approach as he consistently moves forward, innovates, and remains enthusiastic, aspiring for success on a global scale.
about.eusebia-nicole:
A passionate Filipina cyclist who loves riding her bike through the beautiful places in the Philippines, feeling the wind and enjoying the adventure. Her dad introduced her to cycling, and it became more than just a hobby â€“ it's a journey of discovering herself and being strong.

For five years, Nicole balanced school and sports as a student-athlete.

Driven by her determination and love for cycling and learning, she earned a Bachelor's degree in Science and Tourism Management. Whether challenging herself on the bike trail or studying hard, she aims for excellence and sees challenges as chances to grow.

With a strong desire to be great at cycling, her dreams include competing worldwide, wearing the Olympic colors, and making a mark as a champion in the sport's history.
about.rina-zaki:
Malaysian mountain bike (MTB) rider. She has achieved consistent top finishes in domestic competitions, including a victory at the Malaysia National Championship XCO in 2023, and has maintained stable results across both domestic and international races.

Through participation in Asian championships and MTB Cup series events, she has steadily built international experience. From 2025, she competes internationally as a member of the Asia Union TCS Racing Team. Her riding style is characterized by strong endurance and a consistent race pace, with a focus on achieving results at the top competitive level.

She continues to train and race with the goal of securing higher placements in international competitions.
about.ayaka-hiyoshi:
She began mountain biking at a young age after being introduced to the sport through outings to the mountains with her father and older sister. What started as a fun activity in nature gradually developed into a serious competitive pursuit as she discovered the enjoyment of riding off-road.

In the youth category, she has achieved multiple victories in domestic competitions and has consistently contended for top positions at the All-Japan Championships and national cup races, demonstrating steady and reliable progress. As a member of the Asia Union TCS Racing Team, she competes in both domestic and international events, continuing to build her experience and performance level.

Her long-term goal is to finish in the top 10 at the Olympic Games. She trains and races daily with dedication toward achieving that objective.
about.tshewang-norbu:
He is a mountain bike cross-country (MTB XCO) rider from Ladakh, India. Born and raised at an altitude of approximately 3,500 meters, he has developed strong endurance and mental toughness through training in a harsh natural environment. Starting on the rugged trails of Ladakh, he has steadily progressed from local races to national and international competitions, representing both his state and India. His strengths lie in his high endurance and consistent race performance, even under pressure.

Aiming to compete at the highest level in the world, he continues to challenge himself on the international stage as a representative of India, while aspiring to inspire the next generation of athletes from remote and high-altitude regions. Through his own journey, he seeks to demonstrate that environmental and geographical limitations can be overcome, and to contribute to the growth and development of mountain biking in India and across Asia.
